CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper July 14, 1945, pg. 17, reads: "Joins Perfect Class - Roy Gantt of 774 Anaheim Street joined the golf world's hall of fame last week, when he made a hole-in-one at South Park. He sank a No. 5 iron shot on the 151-yard fifteenth hole. He was playing with Charles Ashby, Louis Elley and Chief Petty Officer John Anderson at the time. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Golfer Roy Gantt posed swinging golf club, possibly at South Park
